hint.text: Add the desired value to the number and find the square root using long division method.

solution.text:
We know that \(3100\) is not a perfect square because on performing long division we get the remainder as \(75\).
Adding \(36\) to \(3100\), we get,
\(3100+36=3136\)
Perform long division method to find square root of \(3136\) as shown below.
Therefore, the square root of \(3136\) is \(56\)

content.text: Find the square root of the perfect square above.
